abilities.description: The user can reverse the petrification effect at will, restoring victims to their normal state with no memory of being turned to stone.
abilities.limitations: Only the original user can reverse their own petrification effects. Even if someone else consumes the fruit later, they cannot undo Hancock's petrifications.

abilities.description: The user fires a heart-shaped beam that turns anyone who feels lust toward them into stone.
abilities.limitations: Only works on those who feel attraction or lust toward the user. Those with pure hearts or no attraction are unaffected.

abilities.description: The user draws a large heart and fires multiple arrows that petrify on contact.
abilities.limitations: Requires the user to form the heart shape first.

keyMoments.title: Hancock Unfreezes the Marines
keyMoments.description: Hancock demonstrates her ability to reverse petrification by unfreezing all the Marines aboard Momonga's ship. The Marines have no memory of being frozen.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals an important aspect of the Mero Mero no Mi - that victims have no memory of being petrified and that the effect is completely reversible at the user's will.

consumptionHistory.circumstances: Force-fed by a World Noble during her enslavement

description: The Mero Mero no Mi is a Paramecia-type Devil Fruit that allows the user to turn anyone who feels lust or attraction toward them into stone. The user can also reverse the petrification at will, and victims have no memory of being frozen.
strengths: Works on multiple targets at once
Reversible at will by the user
Victims have no memory of petrification
weaknesses: Does not affect those without lust or attraction to the user
Standard Devil Fruit weaknesses (seawater, Seastone, Haki)
Only the original user can reverse their petrifications
